Source copy consulted: Manuscript, Special Collections, Alderman Library, University of Virginia
Source copy consulted: Manuscript, Special Collections, Alderman Library, University of Virginia
Letter from Maria Clemm [1] to an unknown correspondent, 1865 October 6 Manuscript, University of Virginia

I have just received your most welcome letter for it has been so very long since I have heard from you, I am better again, and as soon as I am able I will comply with request, now I can scarcely write those few lines. No, I have not heard from Mr Lewis or the drep either. God help my poor soul that is obliged to ask a favor, altho I am just going to ask one of you, but I feel so sure if it is in your power you will grant it I want $5 or even three more than I ever did in my whole life, cannot you procure it for me some how , oh if you could only know how much I am in need of it you would try to send it to me, if possible write by return of mail. I am very sad to day for tomorrow is the anniversary of my darling Eddies death. please excuse this piece of paper I have no other and have not the means of getting it
I am ever your true friend "Muddie"
